greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of aperiodic permutations of {1..n}.
comment: A permutation is defined to be aperiodic if every cyclic rotation of {1..n} acts on the cycle decomposition to produce a different digraph.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..200
Gus Wiseman, Cycle decompositions of the a(4) = 16 aperiodic permutations.
program: (PARI) a(n) = sumdiv(n, d, moebius(n/d)*(n/d)^d*d!); \\ _Andrew Howroyd_, Aug 19 2019
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Mar 04 2019
ext: Terms a(10) and beyond from _Andrew Howroyd_, Aug 19 2019
